main.name: Kyle McReynolds
main.description: I enjoy building everything from small business sites to rich interactive web apps
main.bio: I am a full stack developer whose background emphasizes communication and interpersonal skills. I use online resources, teamwork and internal drive to accomplish tasks in the most efficient, clean manner available.
main.contactmessage: If you are a business seeking a web presence or an employer looking to hire, please feel free to reach out!

resume.skillmessage: Below are SOME of the technologeis I use regularly:

education.degree: Certificate - Web Programming w/ Python & Javascript
education.description: Deep dive into the design and implementation of web apps with Python, JavaScript, and SQL using frameworks like Django, React, and Bootstrap. Topics include database design, scalability, security, and user experience. Through hands-on projects, I learned to write and use APIs, create interactive UIs, and leverage cloud services like GitHub and Heroku.

Coding Dojo is an immersive bootcamp where students are taught three full stacks in 16 weeks. I coded 12-14 hours per day totaling well over 1000 hours with a focus on Python, Javascript, & Java. Did a deep dive into the Mean stack, Python/Django stack, and Java/Spring Boot stack. Through hand-on projects, I learned the agile development lifecycle, created REST APIs, and leveraged cloud services like AWS & Github.

Relevant completed courses: Marketing Research, Consumer Behavior, Strategic Marketing Management, Promotional Strategy, Business Statistics, and Global Marketing. Capstone peoject: 'The importance of having a professional looking website where potential customers can get in touch with you 24/7'.

work.title: Product Marketing
work.description: Worked under the Wireless and Sensing Business Unit to facilitate various marketing and sales enablement activities. Analyzed GPS Market research across multiple paid sources and presented findings to management to better position our LoRa based products for success, which lead to a more informed and strategic new product launch. Analyzed the sales pipeline and built in-depth, interactive dashboards that helped identify areas of improvement and teams that needed additional resources. Created a product roadmap and end-to-end user guide for our LoRa Gateways and Transceivers group which helped convey our message in sales presentations and better equip customers for success.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Designing and prototyping the front end of the product website. Writing reusable components using Angular, HTML, CSS, TypeScript, and Angular Material for the product website Using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and Material Design Bootstrap to implement the company website. Testing and Maintaining the front end part of the marketing and product website.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Created a proof of concept to share with investors by building a customer facing UI using React leading to additional investment opportunities within a 1 month debut. Created Elasticsearch capabilities by converting 65,000 MySQL data points into a non-relational format and manipulated the data with Pandas in order to create various data visualizations with Kibana & React. Automated deployment of the AWS web server by creating a bash script that runs when the instance boots up.

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: Coding Dojo teaches students three full stacks in 15 weeks. During each stack we would complete increasingly complex assignments moving from simple routing, through DOM manipulation, RESTful tasks and beyond. These 20 - 30 small projects would culminate in an exam. These exams require students to build a full-stack web-app based on a wire frame within 4.5 hous. My projects can all be viewed on my portfolio site, or GitHub. Finally, during my time at Coding Dojo I participated in 2 - 3 unique and increasingly challenging algorithms each day, learning how to manipulate different data structures including but not limited to binary search trees, singly and doubly linked lists, stacks, and tries.

work.title: Account Manager
work.description: Parsed through a bucket of 1500+ untouched sales leads by proposing and implementing a new sales automation tool (SalesLoft), which lead to a 20% conversion rate. Hosted and delivered webinars and conference calls to B/C level executives and successfully converted 100+ new opportunities, totaling over $12 million dollars in potential revenue. Directly contacted the VP of automation at my prior company(Sherwin-Williams) and brought a $1.2 million dollar opportunity into fruition

projects.title: Flack
projects.category: A simplified slack clone demonstratig sockets

projects.title: Honorable Mention
projects.category: (No longer Deployed) Website I built that can store recommended places to visit and display them on a map. I used Python and Django and the mapbox API

projects.title: Angles 5000
projects.category: A freelance website I made for a hair salon using Angular.

projects.title: On The Spot Recipes
projects.category: A website I created that generates dessert recipes based off of ingredients that you have. I used Angular, Express, and Node.

testimonials.text: Kyle was very easy to communicate with and was able to execute exactly what we were looking for in our new website. In the first month we had almost one thousand unique vistiors to our new website and it has drawn in a ton of new business. Thanks Kyle!
